Sorry to be impatient, but when getting used to the fact, that your normal superb response time almost always is less than 24 hours, one tends to get very demanding :-)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7108].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

In jira-application.properties I see the availability to customize the email header format. This is what I have:

# Specifies the From: header format in notification emails. Default is of the form "John Doe (JIRA) <jira@company.com>".
# Available variables are ${fullname}, ${email} and ${email.hostname}
# If commented out, format is just 'jira@company.com'
# default: jira.email.fromheader.format = ${fullname} (JIRA)
jira.email.fromheader.format = ${email} (${fullname}) via JIRA

The problem is that the actual address (if the user clicks to "Reply") is not that, but the one specified for the project, so users will just click Reply not realizing that the reply to address is not what is shown. What's more, I do not see any of the variables available to show the sender's address (e.g. project1@company.com). Is there a way to get the reply-to address to be the actual user's address (it SHOWS in the email as the sender). Do you understand my question?

Thanks
fields.summary: Option to set sender address reply to actual user's address in email notifications

fields.description:
I have created a text field which needs to be more than 255 characters. I configured my issue navigator see display that field. However, it only displays the first 60 or so characters, and then just displays "...". 

I think I could live with the problem of showing the "..." on the web interface (since you wouldn't want a field of unlimited length to screw up the browser display), but the Excel (current fields) output should be smart enough to export the entire field value, which DOES export correctly when using the "All fields" export.. This may be similar to JRA-6570.
fields.summary: Excel view does not display all of a text field's value

fields.description:
I am playing around with the new Screens features. Kudos on a powerful and easy to use tool to streamline data entry.
I have successfully created tabs and added the ability to edit (custom) fields when a developer resolves an issue.
However, I have not been able to figure out how to to the same on the "Assign Issue" operation. That is not a workflow operation, and in the "Add Issue Operation To Screen Association" form, the dropdown " Issue Operation:" doesn't allow for "Assign". Am I missing something, or is it just not possible to customize this screen in the same way?
fields.summary: How can I customize the "Assign Issue" operation screen?

fields.description:
Go to Screens, and click "Configure" next to one of the screens.
The page has this:

Configure Screen
Add a new tab to the <screen 1 name> screen.
This page shows the way the fields are organised on <screen 2 name> screen. 

Notice that the screen names don't match. The screen 1 name displayed is the last one you were working on, while the screen 2 name is the correct one you are actually working on. If you cannot reproduce at first, click on View all screens and then select another screen to configure. Then you'll see the problem.
Refreshing the page gets the top screen name to be displayed correctly.
fields.summary: Configure screen shows wrong screen name

fields.description: As a private installation, users cannot sign up for an account. I've hidden the option in a few places (by removing links to Contact administrators, etc.), but if my understanding is correct, if the installation mode is marked as "Private" users should not see options to sign up. I see it in various login screens, or if users attempt to visit a URL without having logged in first. It is confusing for users to see this phrasing, and I think it would be an improvement to remove mention of signing up or links for same if running in private mode.
fields.summary: remove 'signup' options from various screen in private installation

fields.description:
EditApplicationProperties uses io.ByteToCharConverter to test whether an encoding is supported.

The class is removed from JDK 1.6-ea, so it looks like it will be removed from JDK1.6.

It is not a good idea to use this class in general as it appears to be Sun JDK specific.

JIRA 3.2.1 (and earlier) will throw the following error when editing General Configuration:

HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [EditApplicationProperties]:sun/io/ByteToCharConverter
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: sun/io/ByteToCharConverter
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.EditApplicationProperties.doValidation(EditApplicationProperties.java:106) at webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:373) at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:150) at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:46) at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:131) at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:186) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853) at
fields.summary: Remove dependency on io.ByteToCharConverter from EditApplicationProperties

fields.description: All of our scoping estimates are done in hours.  JIRA converts these estimates to days or weeks when displaying them.  Is there any way to configure JIRA to always use a particular unit of time (e.g. hours) when displaying effort estimates?  If not, it would be nice to be able to configure this.  It would also be nice to be able to assign a number of hours per day that a particular user is available when doing the conversion from hours to days.  I found a setting to specify # of hours per day on a system-wide basis, but I couldn't find a place to set this on a per-user basis.
fields.summary: Ability to specify hours per day on a per-person basis

fields.description:
We plan to implement Jira in our company and for this we must prove that regular updates from our old issue tracking system are possible. For this I am writing a Jira service that should get all the issues that have changed in the old system and create/update the issues in Jira.

For the update I have to check whether an issue has already been imported or not, thus I need to search a Jira issue by a custom field value. I use the code proposed in JRA-7031but then the service crashes when I re-index all bugs after the import.

The simplest code (not very functional ;-) ) to demonstrate this behavior:

    public void run() {
        SearchRequest sr = new SearchRequest(true); // search without security checks
        sr.addParameter(new ProjectParameter(new Long(10001))); // id of existing project
        try {
            com.opensymphony.user.User adminUser = UserUtils.getUser("admin"); // the super user
            ManagerFactory.getIssueManager().execute(sr, adminUser); // if this line is commented, no exception raised at reindex
            ManagerFactory.getIndexManager().reIndexAll(); // THIS WILL CRASH
        }
        catch (Exception e) {
            // ignore
        }
   }

fields.description:
In version 3.03, I was used to seeing the message "Note: The 'Project Information' panel is not available." displayed for every project. Eventually I learned it only applies to projects with versions and/or components, neither of which we use, and I never reported it as a problem.
In 3.2.1, this part of the screen is even more prominent with an additional table below: "  Select: Project Information". 
Neither should appear if the project has no version or component information.
See screen shots.

fields.description: I know you guys are working towards improving the search filter capabilities with regards to querying, but sometimes we need to group issues together based on an arbitrary selection of issues (maybe even across projects). For example, at Atlassian, you have your most popular issues (based on votes). We might also have a list of issues that need to be grouped together for some purpose, that is not easily defined by priorities or assignees. It would be nice if we could provide/edit a comma delimited list of issue keys to use/save as a search. Has this request been raised before?
fields.summary: Allow for list of issues to be saved as a filter

fields.description:
When you attempt to use the SOAP interface and remote API is turned off all you get is a soap fault with a message of "500 server error".  Would it be possible to either return a more descriptive error message or some other way of detecting if the remote API is active?

I can't assume that a response code of 500 means the API is disabled (it could be a severe server error)

Even returning something like "501 Not Implemented" would be helpful (although not really compliant with the HTTP spec)

fields.description:
When importing a bugzilla project into a Jira instance which already contains usernames equivalent to those in the bugzilla project, the import fails when attempting to match the existing usernames.  

Note that the Jira instance already contains projects, but not the same project that is being imported from Bugzilla (i.e. project being imported is a NEW project); however, jira users in the existing Jira projects have the same usernames as jira users existing in the bugzilla project being imported.

This issue occurs regardless of whether the "Reuse Existing User Accounts" option is checked or not during the import.

I've run some tests with dummy user accounts (i.e. creating the same user account in both Bugzilla and Jira), and have noticed that if the offending user in Jira is deleted, the importer succeeds (i.e. the importer can simply create the new jira user, and doesn't need to worry about an existing jira user with bugzilla account name).  The problem is that the existing Jira users all have issues in other Jira projects, and thus cannot be deleted -- the existing users must be re-used by the Bugzilla importer.  

All existing Jira users are members of the "jira-users" group.

See the attached error.txt for an instance of the error thrown for each user conflict encountered (i.e. each time the bugzilla importer attempts to import/reuse an existing jira user)
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer fails when importing existing users

fields.description:
After exporting data from 3.1.1 and importing into 3.2.1 JIRA runs EXTREMELY slow on most pages. Cached issues seems to come up with a decent (but by no means optimal) response time, while anything to do with searching the indexes (Dashboard, Project reports, etc..) is unresponsive to the point of being unusable.

The "Create Issue" page (post project and issue type selection, i.e. the page with the fields on it) takes anywhere from a minute to two minutes to come up.

I have a suspicion this is related to our custom fields and layouts, but I have found no way to remove these settings to see if JIRA runs faster without them.

thanks for your support.
fields.summary: Problems migrating to 3.2.1 from 3.1.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7056].
  {panel}

{panel:title=22nd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

We have a workflow that requires issues to be linked on a regular basis to their parent issues.  Thus we have Parent Issue P-1 and then we create user stories U-1, U-2, ..., U-n to support it, where n may be a large number.  Currently, we need to create the issue and then manually click Link Issue then find the right one, then click 'Accept' etc etc.

Can I propose a new 'Create Linked Issue' as part of an issue's operations?  You would then see the same screen as 'Create New Issue' but you'd also have a link drop-down to select the link you want.  When the issue is created the link is then there already.

I think this would greatly simplify the workflow of creating issue links.  Thanks!

fields.description: After spending 15 minutes or so tweaking a dashboard, I realized that I had a typo in one of the tab (portal) names.  For the life of me, I could not figure out how to edit the tab name.  I ended up creating a new tab (portal) and deleting the old one.
fields.summary: Is it possible to rename a portal page in a custom dashboard?

fields.description:
Should I be concerned about this warning:

[http-8080-Processor25] 2005-06-16 10:32:02,926 ERROR [velocity] Left side of addition operation is not a valid type. Currently only integers (1,2,3...) and Integer type is supported. templates/jira/issue/field/priority-edit.vm [line 12, column 55]
fields.summary: Should I be concerned about velocity warning in priority-edit.vm?

fields.description: The notification schemes seem to feel that all issues are created equal, but this notion is rarely the case.  As a project lead, I am really only interested in seeing issues that are created, resolved, reopened, etc. when those issues are of a certain type and priority.  It is a pain to also get notified of to-do type "issues" that have a great deal of value to individual team members but no one else.
fields.summary: Add ability to filter notification based on issue type and priority.

fields.description:
This is showing up in the logs:

[http-8080-Processor21] 2005-06-16 09:36:23,681 WARN [workflow.function.misc.FlushCachesFunction] FlushCachesFunction is deprecated, as it no longer serves any purpose.  You can safely remove it from your workflow.

Should I be concerned?
fields.summary: Should I be concerned about FlushCachesFunction warning?
Searching issue by custom field value through the API

fields.description: Clients that use the project table portlet are requesting that they be able to choose which projects they see listed in the table.
fields.summary: Allow Filter in Project Table Portlet

fields.description:
Hi,

Is there any way of changing the order of the fields shown in the subject of a mail notification? For example, I'd like this notification's mail subject:

[JIRA] Reopened: (TECCQA-330) IDEA license for Alfonso Soler

...so it looks like...

[JIRA] (TECCQA-330) Reopened: Licencia de IDEA para Alfonso Soler

Is it possible?


TIA
fields.summary: How to change the order of fields in the subject of mail notifications
Make log parsing case insensitve on JIRA project key

fields.description:
If I set a number of working days of 8 hours /day in the time tracking configuration, and set an estimate of 1 week on a issue, it is displayed as 1 day, 16 hours.

 It should be displayed as 5 days or 1 week in the navigator.
fields.summary: Original estimate display is not using the user-selected number of working hours per day (but the default one : 24h/day)

fields.description: When reassigning issues during "change workflow" for a project, the number of "affected issues" looks strange. Perhaps you have forgotten a constraint for the select? Looks like you count all "bugs" and "new features" instead of counting only the affected bugs and the affected new features.
fields.summary: Counting error when reassigning issues during workflow change?

fields.description: Add note on upgrade documentation regarding plugin property files - these files are not included in the backup process and should be manually copied across if configuring a new installation.
fields.summary: Add note on upgrade docs regarding plugin property files

fields.description: The screen capture functionality on Mac is different to Windows so we should document how this all works.
fields.summary: Document Attach Screenshot Feature

fields.description: This was seen on the support site for confluence. Hiding and then showing the field returns it to its normal state, but it should never be in that state in the first place. Even though the field is marked are required, there is no validation done to enforce it, the symptom is just that you see a "*" next to the input for the field.
fields.summary: Somehow the attachment field  is marked as required, even though this should not be possible
Allow support for project schemes or templates

fields.description: At the moment the cascading list box has one name. It would be great if we allowed to name the drop downs separately. For example if we have a version/build number list managed by the field then the name of the first drop down will be "version" and the next "build number".
fields.summary: Add ability to name each drop down of the cascading select list.

fields.description:
1. Create a screen with three or more tabs.
2. Create a screen schema, assigning above screen to view issue.
3. View an issue.

Expected: all tabs will show up

Actual: only two tabs show up

Notes: This happens regardless of which fields are on which screen and whether fields have values or not. It appears that the two tabs shown are the first two created in the screen definition. Rearranging tab order has no effect. Using the same screen for Edit or Create results in expected behavior - all tabs shown.
fields.summary: View Issue screens limited to two tabs

fields.description:
After successfully upgrading to 3.2.1 from 3.1.1, I attempted to restore import ids that had been removed when editing the issue (see JRA-6533).  After inserting customfieldvalue rows in the database, I attempted to re-index, but the system has been hung for 15+ minutes, with nothing being written to the logs.  It took under 5 minutes to re-index when restoring during the upgrade procedure.

Unavailable message:

JIRA is currently being reindexed. Depending on how large the issue database is, this may take a few minutes. Jira will automatically become available as soon as this task is complete.
This process is 2147483647% Completed. 

From stdout.log:

2005-06-15 15:53:36,707 ERROR [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Error getting number of issues from database.  Reindexing progress indicator will be incorrect
fields.summary: JIRA hangs when re-indexing

fields.description: If I create a new group with a permission scheme that only allows for "Browse Projects" functionality, and add a user to that group (and jira-users), that user still has the ability to edit, delete, comment and create new issues.  How can I create one project with two types of users.  One that has full access, and another that is ready only?
fields.summary: Read only permissions not functioning properly.  Not 'sticking'.

fields.description: Allow request of email notification for other users. If I know that another user would be interested in a specific issue then it would be nice to directly add here/him as a subscriber for email notification.
fields.summary: Allow request of email notification for other users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7008].
  {panel}

When adding a comment to an issue, the comment can be set to be Viewable By a specific group. The groups that are listed in this select box are the groups that the user is assigned to.

My suggestion: This list should instead include the groups AND the users that has the Browse Projects permission for the specfic project and NOT the groups that the current isuer is assigned to.

Today, i can make comments viewable to groups that don't have browse permission to the project. That does not give much sense.

Further more: it would be great, if the box was a multiple select box.
fields.summary: Comment Viewable By should show groups with project browse permission

fields.description:
When entering time estimates, we always use hours. And in all our correspondence with the customers, we also refer to estimates in hours.

It's annoying that JIRA converts the estimates to days, weeks and so on according to the conversion rule that must be entered. My rule says, that a working day is 6 hous. When giving an estimate of 10 hours, JIRA converts this to 1 dag and 4 hours.

Is there a way to avoid this conversion so that the estimate always is shown in hours? If not i would like to request this feature.
fields.summary: Avoid conversion of time estimates

fields.description:
The problem is that the map is static so the synchronised init method does very little. Thus multiple threads can start initing the Map causing a huge CPU load. The threads are stuck in:

"ApplicationServerThread" prio=1 tid=0x084d9cf8 nid=0x7932 runnable [9c97c000..9c97e86c]
        at java.util.HashMap.put(HashMap.java:382)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.util.HelpUtil.loadExternalProperties(HelpUtil.java:105)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.util.HelpUtil.init(HelpUtil.java:45)
        - locked <0xa17857e8> (a com.atlassian.jira.web.util.HelpUtil)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.util.HelpUtil.<init>(HelpUtil.java:36)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.util.HelpUtil.<init>(HelpUtil.java:31)

Need to synchronise on the class rather than the object to ensure only one thread can init the static map.
fields.summary: Synchronizing on the class when changing a static map in HelpUtil

fields.description:
Hi,

I noticed a bug on your website. On http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/extending.html, selecting 'custom field types' (in the 'Custom Field Types' entry) results in a '500 Internal Server Error/More than 10 loops - erroring out.' using Opera and FireFox. IE only shows a 500.
fields.summary: Link broken on jira docs, link to 'custom field types' on page extending.html is broken

fields.description:
Roadmap returning wrong issue completed progress

It seems that the total issues only for Unresolved issues, thus sometimes giving a negative count of issues remaining:

see http://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-1786
fields.summary: Roadmap returning wrong issue completed progress

fields.description:
Comment deletion leaves change history that is visble to all

This is really an issue where people go "Please delete my comment for security reasons!". You delete the comment but the entire information in the comment is still viewable by all. I'm not sure what the ideal solution is but perhaps the change history for the deleted comment should only appear to those with the delete comment permission?
fields.summary: Comment deletion leaves change history that is visble to all

fields.description: regarding the fix for JRA-6100 the path genrated to icons is incorrect : double slashes don't work with Apache 1.3.33 / mod_jk 1.2.10 /Tomcat 4.1.31 I don't exactly understand why, but IE6 and Mozilla believe that image url is http://images/icons/priority_major.gif without any server name (not linked to the server config then)
fields.summary: Help icons on the local help pages are broken

fields.description: While the ability to export and import the entire database as an XML file is nice, the need for this function doesn't really come up that much (at least for us).  What we would use a great deal, however, is a function to export a particular project and then import it as a different name.  Essentially, the need is for a project template(s) that can be used as a starting point for new projects.
fields.summary: Add ability to export/import projects

fields.description: I created a custom numeric priority field and would prefer that my dashboard default to sorting on it (and a combination of other fields).  But I cannot see a way to change the default sort (I do not wish to filter out items on the main list, just change the sort order).
fields.summary: Ability to change default sort field(s)

fields.description:
I created a custom priority field that stored numbers in the form x.yz (so 1.01, 1.23, 4.99).  If I click on the column header in the dashboard, an error is given:
An error occurred searching: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "1.51"

I prefer the default sort order to be on priority, so this is hindering usability of the product to a great degree, especially as the list gets large.
fields.summary: numeric custom priority field causes error on sort

fields.description: Need method to upload XML docs into JIRA so we can assign individual tasks to JIRA users.  Our web-based JIRA users could then track their assignments without using MS-Project.
fields.summary: Need method to upload XML docs into JIRA so we can assign individual tasks to JIRA users

fields.description:
According to JRA-6602, the Alt-# workflow shortcut keys were removed because they caused problems on Linux for Firefox users.

I would like to see them restored, at least on non-Linux platforms.
fields.summary: Restore workflow action shortcuts

fields.description: While viewing http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/install.html in IE 6, note that the left side of text in the right-hand column is cut off, rendering some text unreadable.  Page renders properly in Firefox.  See attachments.
fields.summary: Website: CSS misalignment prevents some text from displaying on IE 6

fields.description:
This is not resolved with running the .jar as per http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5347
JRA-4980 does not make it clear how to recover - do I do as Jeff Turner suggests, on the live Jira (3.0.3), re-export, and then try that in the new version ?

We are payed-up Profesional version customers.

Our export file is only 3 meg, but obviously contains much confidential data - though I am happy to look through it for you if you tell me what to look for, I'd rather not attach it here.

Would another upgrade approach be to backup the Oracle database schema, stop the exisiting, and then start the new  Jira against the same DB and let ofbiz do it's upgrade magic ?
fields.summary: Error importing 3.0.3 exported xml into 3.2.1
